stages.headline: Welcome! Today, we will learn to recognize and draw some basic geometric shapes.
This is a square. It has four equal sides and four right angles.
Now, please draw a square.
stages.problemText: The student is asked to draw a square.
stages.correctAnswer: A four-sided shape with equal sides and four right (90-degree) angles.
stages.solutionSteps: Draw a closed shape with four straight lines of equal length, meeting at right angles.
stages.customInstructions: Be encouraging. If the drawing is a closed shape with four sides, mark it as 'correct'. Only mark 'incorrect' if it’s clearly another shape. Do not criticize small imperfections.

stages.headline: This is a triangle. It has three sides.
Now, please draw a triangle.
stages.problemText: The student is asked to draw a triangle.
stages.solutionSteps: Draw a closed shape made of three straight lines.
stages.customInstructions: Be encouraging. If the drawing has three sides, mark it as 'correct'. Only mark 'incorrect' if it has more or fewer sides.

stages.headline: This is a circle. It is perfectly round and has no corners.
Now, please draw a circle.
stages.problemText: The student is asked to draw a circle.
stages.correctAnswer: A round shape with no corners.
stages.solutionSteps: Draw one continuous curved line that connects to itself, with all points roughly the same distance from the center.
stages.customInstructions: Be encouraging. If the drawing is a single closed loop, mark it as 'correct'. Only mark 'incorrect' if it’s clearly another shape.

stages.headline: Great work! You have learned to recognize and draw a square, a triangle, and a circle.
